definition: arrow/dart/straight/to vow/to swear/old variant of 屎[shi3]
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to know/to become aware of/also pr. [zhi1 dao5]
to find out/to know/to learn about
not to know/unaware/unknowingly/fig. not to admit (defeat, hardships, tiredness etc)
to know the facts/to understand/to be familiar with the situation
see 眾所周知|众所周知[zhong4 suo3 zhou1 zhi1]
it is obvious that.../as one can well imagine...

sentences.english: If any debt becomes overdue, inform the branch head immediately.
sentences.chinese: 如遇應收賬款逾期未到帳，立即告知知分公司總經理。

sentences.english: Professor Teng taught us a lot.
sentences.chinese: 鄧教授曾傳授我們很多知識。

sentences.english: Products in the market have a certain visibility, increasing brand.
sentences.chinese: 產品在市場具有一定的知明度，品牌效應與日俱增。

sentences.english: Their number incalculable; Thus also is the assembly of Bodhisattvas.
sentences.chinese: 非是算數之所能知，諸菩薩衆，亦復如是。

sentences.english: Health his not valued till sickness comes.
Conscious Awareness of Innate Knowledge instead the Investigation of Things, he made a whole new interpretation of the phenomena of nature.
sentences.chinese: 他以致知代替誠意，對格物進行了全新的解釋。

sentences.english: One time I asked him, you know China?
sentences.chinese: 有次我問佢，你知中國咩？

sentences.english: "Weeding" is not just a poem hard to know, we need action.
sentences.chinese: 《鋤禾》不只是詩，知辛苦，更需要行動。

sentences.english: His most vaunted exploits were exposed as largely fictitious.
sentences.chinese: 他最自豪的功績，戳穿後才知大抵都是虛構的。

sentences.english: The bushes in the mouth bird flowers habitat raising An Nian.
sentences.chinese: 那灌木叢裏的知更雀就在叼起的花蕊裏棲養安年。

sentences.english: For lifting by crane or other means, please call us for a surcharge.
sentences.chinese: 若需以吊車或其他方式吊運，請來電告知費用另計。

sentences.english: None but the wearer knows where the shoe pinches .
sentences.chinese: 只有那個穿鞋人，才知哪裏鞋軋腳。

sentences.english: Summer, the magician the cicadas cry out for us to sing.
sentences.chinese: 夏天，魔術師把知了喊出來爲我們唱歌。

sentences.english: Mr. Wang really didn't know what to do with fabulous fortune at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 王師少西席一時沒有知如何措置那筆鉅額財產。

sentences.english: I would not call thee fool, old man.
sentences.chinese: 我不會喚汝愚人，年長知者。

definition: not to know/unaware/unknowingly/fig. not to admit (defeat, hardships, tiredness etc)
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
to give up/to abandon/to give alms
to be versed in/to know well
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
dawn/daybreak/to know/to let sb know/to make explicit
to know the facts/to understand/to be familiar with the situation
